features.headline: A CMS With Version Control Built-in
features.text: Tina is a fully open-source headless CMS that supports Git

features.headline: Own Your Content
features.text: Don't lock your content in a 3rd-party service.  Tina writes to files in your repository (MDX, Markdown, JSON, etc)

features.headline: An API For Your Files
features.text: Easily fetch your file-based content using Tina's Data Layer. With Tina, Markdown content can be federated across other sites and applications.

features.headline: Configure with Code
features.text: Tina is code-first and fully typed. Define your CMS in a config file and check it into Git.

testimonials.name: Peter Rusin
testimonials.testimonial: I tried a dozen CMSs and I have to say, as an engineer, I like Tina the most.

testimonials.name: Dave Keen
testimonials.testimonial: I’ve been playing with TinaCMS for the last week and it’s absolutely amazing. Its so simple to install, the typed NextJS integration is amazing, the live editor is as good as it gets and compared to other CMSs the admin is incredibly easy for editors to understand and use.

testimonials.name: Vatosteve
testimonials.testimonial: Loving Tina CMS so far. It is exactly what I’ve been looking for.

testimonials.name: david.oviedo
testimonials.testimonial: Been running a project with Tina for a few months now and we absolutely love it. I had been looking for a CMS that let us build our sites the way we wanted to while letting the non-techies edit the content in a visual and painless way, and Tina just lets you do that.

testimonials.name: Sean Pearce
testimonials.testimonial: We really liked using Tina and we will definitely suggest it to clients in the future. Tina's in-context editor cannot be beaten. We are actually planning on using it for our new website as well, so we’re all in on it.

testimonials.name: Billy Best
testimonials.testimonial: Just found this and I think I am already in love.

testimonials.name: Mravec
testimonials.testimonial: Just tried out click-to-edit and wanted to let you know it's really awesome, great feature, super easy to use and to setup, love that it's fully typed and works passed down as a prop, kinda feels like magic tbh.

features.headline: Merge With Confidence
features.text: Tina Cloud Enterprise customers can review, approve, and manage content  on different branches.

features.headline: Unbeatable UX
features.text: Editing content in Markdown, MDX, and JSON files doesn't need to feel clunky.  Tina supports a live preview that takes the UX to the next level.

items.headline: Visual Editing
items.text: See content changes in real-time as you edit.

items.headline: Fully Open-Source
items.text:
Tina is licensed under Apache 2.0. 
It can be self-hosted or hosted on Tina Cloud.

items.headline: Develop Locally
items.text: Run Tina locally and talk to your local filesystem.

items.headline: 3rd-party Media
items.text: Store Media assets in your repo or connect to S3, Cloudinary, etc.

items.headline: Composable Blocks
items.text: Create reusable components that you can edit with Tina. Let your team assemble pages like a site-builder.

items.headline: Markdown at Scale
items.text: Tina powers sites with 10’s of thousands of pages with great performance.
